intro: Germainia thorelii, commonly known as the Thorell's germander, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its upright growth habit and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically has hairy stems and leaves that are opposite in arrangement. It produces bright red or pink flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Germainia thorelii is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments.
